intro: Galium cariense, commonly known as Carpathian bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium cariense is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
